96.Ali Quli Qara'i: He said, ‘I saw what they did not see. I took a handful [of dust] from the messenger’s trail and threw it. That is how my soul prompted me.’

97.Ali Quli Qara'i: He said, ‘Begone! It shall be your [lot] throughout life to say, ‘‘Do not touch me!’’ Indeed there is a tryst for you which you will not fail to keep! Now look at your god to whom you went on clinging. We will burn it down and then scatter it[s ashes] into the sea

98.Ali Quli Qara'i: Indeed your God is Allah. There is no god except Him. He embraces all things in [His] knowledge.’

99.Ali Quli Qara'i: Thus do We relate to you some accounts of what is past. Certainly We have given you a Reminder from Ourselves

100.Ali Quli Qara'i: Whoever disregards it shall bear its onus on the Day of Resurrection

101.Ali Quli Qara'i: remaining in it [forever]. Evil is their burden on the Day of Resurrectio

102.Ali Quli Qara'i: —the day the Trumpet will be blown— on that day We shall muster the guilty with blind eyes

103.Ali Quli Qara'i: They will whisper to one another: ‘You have stayed only for ten [days].&rsquo

104.Ali Quli Qara'i: We know best what they will say, when the best of them in conduct will say, ‘You stayed only a day!’

105.Ali Quli Qara'i: They question you concerning the mountains. Say, ‘My Lord will scatter them [like dust].&rsquo

106.Ali Quli Qara'i: Then He will leave it a level plain

107.Ali Quli Qara'i: You will not see any crookedness or unevenness in it

108.Ali Quli Qara'i: On that day they will follow a summoner in whom there will be no deviousness. The voices will be muted before the All-beneficent, and you will hear nothing but a murmur

109.Ali Quli Qara'i: Intercession will not avail that day except from him whom the All-beneficent allows and approves of his word

110.Ali Quli Qara'i: He knows that which is before them and that which is behind them, but they cannot comprehend Him in their knowledge

111.Ali Quli Qara'i: All faces shall be humbled before the Living One, the All-sustainer, and he will fail who bears [the onus of] wrongdoing

112.Ali Quli Qara'i: But whoever does righteous deeds, should he be faithful, shall neither fear any wrong nor detraction

113.Ali Quli Qara'i: Thus We have sent it down as an Arabic Qur’an and We have paraphrased the threats in it so that they may be Godwary or it may evoke remembrance for them

114.Ali Quli Qara'i: So exalted is Allah, the True Sovereign. Do not hasten with the Qur’an before its revelation is completed for you, and say, ‘My Lord! Increase me in knowledge.’

115.Ali Quli Qara'i: Certainly We had enjoined Adam earlier; but he forgot, and We did not find any resoluteness in him

116.Ali Quli Qara'i: When We said to the angels, ‘Prostrate before Adam,’ they prostrated, but not Iblis: he refused

117.Ali Quli Qara'i: We said, ‘O Adam! This is indeed an enemy of yours and your mate’s. So do not let him expel you from paradise, or you will be miserable

118.Ali Quli Qara'i: Indeed you will neither be hungry in it nor naked

119.Ali Quli Qara'i: Indeed you will neither be thirsty in it, nor suffer from the sun.’

120.Ali Quli Qara'i: Then Satan tempted him. He said, ‘O Adam! Shall I show you the tree of immortality, and an imperishable kingdom?’

121.Ali Quli Qara'i: So they both ate of it, and their nakedness became evident to them, and they began to stitch over themselves with the leaves of paradise. Adam disobeyed his Lord, and went amiss

122.Ali Quli Qara'i: Then his Lord chose him, and turned to him clemently, and guided him

123.Ali Quli Qara'i: He said, ‘Get down both of you from it, all together, being enemies of one another! Yet, should any guidance come to you from Me, those who follow My guidance will not go astray, nor will they be miserable

124.Ali Quli Qara'i: But whoever disregards My remembrance, his shall be a wretched life, and on the Day of Resurrection We shall raise him blind.’

125.Ali Quli Qara'i: He will say, ‘My Lord! Why have You raised me blind, though I used to see?’

126.Ali Quli Qara'i: He will say: ‘So it is. Our signs came to you, but you forgot them, and thus you will be forgotten today.’

127.Ali Quli Qara'i: Thus do We requite him who is a profligate and does not believe in the signs of his Lord. And the punishment of the Hereafter is severer and more lasting

128.Ali Quli Qara'i: Does it not dawn upon them how many generations We have destroyed before them, amid [the ruins of] whose dwellings they walk? There are indeed signs in this for those who have reason

129.Ali Quli Qara'i: And were it not for a prior decree of your Lord and a specified time, it was inevitable

130.Ali Quli Qara'i: So be patient with what they say, and celebrate the praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before the sunset, and glorify Him in watches of the night and at the day’s ends, that you may be pleased

131.Ali Quli Qara'i: Do not extend your glance toward what We have provided certain groups of them as a glitter of the life of this world, so that We may test them thereby. And the provision of your Lord is better and more lasting

132.Ali Quli Qara'i: And bid your family to prayer and be steadfast in its maintenance. We do not ask any provision of you. It is We who provide for you, and the outcome will be in favour of Godwariness

133.Ali Quli Qara'i: They say, ‘Why does he not bring us a sign from his Lord?’ Has there not come to them a manifest proof in that which is in the former scriptures

134.Ali Quli Qara'i: Had We destroyed them with a punishment before it, they would have surely said, ‘Our Lord! Why did You not send us an apostle so that we might follow Your signs before we were abased and disgraced?’

135.Ali Quli Qara'i: Say, ‘Each [of us] is waiting. So wait! Soon you will know who are the people of the right path, and who is guided.’

1.Ali Quli Qara'i: Mankind’s reckoning has drawn near to them, yet they are disregardful in [their] obliviousness

2.Ali Quli Qara'i: There does not come to them any new reminder from their Lord but they listen to it as they play around

3.Ali Quli Qara'i: their hearts set on diversions. The wrongdoers secretly whisper together, [saying], ‘Is not this [man] just a human being like yourselves? Will you give in to magic with open eyes?’

4.Ali Quli Qara'i: He said, ‘My Lord knows every word [spoken] in the sky and the earth, and He is the All-hearing, the All-knowing.’

5.Ali Quli Qara'i: Rather they said, ‘[They are] confused nightmares!’ ‘Rather he has fabricated it!’ ‘Rather he is a poet!’ ‘Let him bring us a sign, like those sent to the ancients.’

6.Ali Quli Qara'i: No town that We destroyed before them believed. Will these then have faith [if they are sent signs]

7.Ali Quli Qara'i: We did not send [any apostles] before you except as men, to whom We revealed. Ask the People of the Reminder if you do not know

8.Ali Quli Qara'i: We did not make them bodies that did not eat food, and they were not immortal

9.Ali Quli Qara'i: Then We fulfilled Our promise to them, and We delivered them and whomever We wished, and We destroyed the profligates

10.Ali Quli Qara'i: Certainly We have sent down to you a Book in which there is an admonition for you. Do you not apply reason

11.Ali Quli Qara'i: How many a town We have smashed that had been wrongdoing, and We brought forth another people after it

12.Ali Quli Qara'i: So when they sighted Our punishment, behold, they ran away from it

13.Ali Quli Qara'i: ‘Do not run away! Return to the opulence you were given to enjoy and to your dwellings so that you may be questioned!’

14.Ali Quli Qara'i: They said, ‘Woe to us! We have indeed been wrongdoers!’

15.Ali Quli Qara'i: That remained their cry until We turned them into a mown field, stilled [like burnt ashes]

16.Ali Quli Qara'i: We did not create the sky and the earth and whatever is between them for play

17.Ali Quli Qara'i: Had We desired to take up some diversion We would have surely taken it up with Ourselves, were We to do [so]

18.Ali Quli Qara'i: Rather We hurl the truth against falsehood, and it crushes its head, and behold, falsehood vanishes! And woe to you for what you allege [about Allah]

19.Ali Quli Qara'i: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth, and those who are near Him do not disdain to worship Him, nor do they become weary

20.Ali Quli Qara'i: They glorify [Him] night and day, and they do not flag

21.Ali Quli Qara'i: Have they taken gods from the earth who raise [the dead]

22.Ali Quli Qara'i: Had there been gods in them other than Allah, they would surely have fallen apart. Clear is Allah, the Lord of the Throne, of what they allege [concerning Him]

23.Ali Quli Qara'i: He is not questioned concerning what He does, but they are questioned

24.Ali Quli Qara'i: Have they taken gods besides Him? Say, ‘Produce your evidence! This is a precept of those who are with me, and a precept of those [who went] before me.’ Rather most of them do not know the truth, and so they are disregardful

25.Ali Quli Qara'i: We did not send any apostle before you but We revealed to him that ‘There is no god except Me; so worship Me.’

26.Ali Quli Qara'i: They say, ‘The All-beneficent has taken offsprings.’ Immaculate is He! Rather they are [His] honoured servants

27.Ali Quli Qara'i: They do not venture to speak ahead of Him, and they act by His command

28.Ali Quli Qara'i: He knows that which is before them and that which is behind them, and they do not intercede except for someone He approves of, and they are apprehensive for the fear of Him

29.Ali Quli Qara'i: Should any of them say, ‘I am a god besides Him,’ We will requite him with hell. Thus do We requite the wrongdoers

30.Ali Quli Qara'i: Have the faithless not regarded that the heavens and the earth were interwoven and We unravelled them, and We made every living thing out of water? Will they not then have faith

31.Ali Quli Qara'i: We set firm mountains in the earth lest it should shake with them, and We made broad ways in them so that they may be guided [to their destinations]

32.Ali Quli Qara'i: We made the sky a preserved roof and yet they are disregardful of its signs

33.Ali Quli Qara'i: It is He who created the night and the day, the sun and the moon, each swimming in an orbit

34.Ali Quli Qara'i: We did not give immortality to any human before you. If you are fated to die, will they live on forever

35.Ali Quli Qara'i: Every soul shall taste death, and We will test you with good and ill by way of test, and to Us you will be brought back

36.Ali Quli Qara'i: Whenever the faithless see you they only take you in derision: ‘Is this the one who speaks ill of your gods?’ And they defy the remembrance of the All-beneficent

37.Ali Quli Qara'i: Man is a creature of haste. Soon I will show you My signs. So do not ask Me to hasten

38.Ali Quli Qara'i: And they say, ‘When will this promise be fulfilled, should you be truthful?’

39.Ali Quli Qara'i: If only the faithless knew of the time when they will not be able to keep the Fire off their faces and their backs, nor will they be helped

40.Ali Quli Qara'i: Rather it will overtake them suddenly, dumbfounding them. So neither will they be able to avert it, nor will they be granted any respite

41.Ali Quli Qara'i: Apostles were certainly derided before you; but those who ridiculed them were besieged by what they had been deriding

42.Ali Quli Qara'i: Say, ‘Who can guard you, day and night, from [the punishment of] the All-beneficent?’ Rather they are disregardful of their Lord’s remembrance

43.Ali Quli Qara'i: Do they have gods besides Us to defend them? Neither can they help themselves, nor can they provide them with an escort against Us

44.Ali Quli Qara'i: Rather We have provided for them and their fathers until they lived on for long years. Do they not see how We visit the land diminishing it at its edges? Are they the ones who will prevail

45.Ali Quli Qara'i: Say, ‘I indeed warn you by the means of revelation.’ But the deaf do not hear the call when they are warned

46.Ali Quli Qara'i: Should a whiff of your Lord’s punishment touch them, they will surely say, ‘Woe to us! We have indeed been wrongdoers!’

47.Ali Quli Qara'i: We shall set up the scales of justice on the Day of Resurrection, and no soul will be wronged in the least. Even if it be the weight of a mustard seed We shall produce it and We suffice as reckoners

48.Ali Quli Qara'i: Certainly We gave Moses and Aaron the Criterion, a light and reminder for the Godwary

49.Ali Quli Qara'i: Those who fear their Lord in secret, and who are apprehensive of the Hour

50.Ali Quli Qara'i: This is a blessed reminder which We have sent down. Will you then deny it

51.Ali Quli Qara'i: Certainly We had given Abraham his rectitude before, and We knew hi

52.Ali Quli Qara'i: when he said to his father and his people, ‘What are these images to which you keep on clinging?’

53.Ali Quli Qara'i: They said, ‘We found our fathers worshipping them.’

54.Ali Quli Qara'i: He said, ‘Certainly you and your fathers have been in manifest error.’

55.Ali Quli Qara'i: They said, ‘Are you telling the truth, or are you [just] kidding?’

56.Ali Quli Qara'i: He said, ‘Rather your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, who originated them, and I am a witness to this

57.Ali Quli Qara'i: By Allah, I will devise a stratagem against your idols after you have gone away.’

58.Ali Quli Qara'i: So he broke them into pieces, —all except the biggest of them— so that they might come back to it

59.Ali Quli Qara'i: They said, ‘Whoever has done this to Our gods?! He is indeed a wrongdoer!’

60.Ali Quli Qara'i: They said, ‘We heard a young man speaking ill of them. He is called ‘‘Abraham.’’ ’

61.Ali Quli Qara'i: They said, ‘Bring him before the people’s eyes so that they may bear witness [against him].&rsquo

62.Ali Quli Qara'i: They said, ‘Was it you who did this to our gods, O Abraham?’

63.Ali Quli Qara'i: He said, ‘Rather it was this biggest of them who did it! Ask them, if they can speak.’

64.Ali Quli Qara'i: Thereat they came to themselves and said [to one another], ‘Indeed it is you who are the wrongdoers!’

65.Ali Quli Qara'i: Then they hung their heads. [They said], ‘You certainly know that they cannot speak.’

66.Ali Quli Qara'i: He said, ‘Do you then worship, besides Allah, that which cannot cause you any benefit or harm

67.Ali Quli Qara'i: Fie on you and what you worship besides Allah! Do you not apply reason?’

68.Ali Quli Qara'i: They said, ‘Burn him, and help your gods, if you are to do anything!’

69.Ali Quli Qara'i: We said, ‘O fire! Be cool and safe for Abraham!’

70.Ali Quli Qara'i: They sought to outmaneuver him, but We made them the biggest losers

71.Ali Quli Qara'i: We delivered him and Lot toward the land which We have blessed for all nations

72.Ali Quli Qara'i: And We gave him Isaac, and Jacob as well for a grandson, and each of them We made righteous

73.Ali Quli Qara'i: We made them imams, guiding by Our command, and We revealed to them the performance of good deeds, the maintenance of prayers, and the giving of zakat, and they used to worship Us

74.Ali Quli Qara'i: We gave judgement and knowledge to Lot, and We delivered him from the town which used to commit vicious acts. Indeed they were an evil and profligate lot

75.Ali Quli Qara'i: And We admitted him into Our mercy. Indeed he was one of the righteous

76.Ali Quli Qara'i: And before that Noah, when he called out, We responded to him and delivered him and his family from the great agony

77.Ali Quli Qara'i: And We helped him against the people who denied Our signs. They were indeed an evil lot; so We drowned them all

78.Ali Quli Qara'i: And David and Solomon when they gave judgement concerning the tillage when the sheep of some people strayed into it by night, and We were witness to their judgement

79.Ali Quli Qara'i: We gave its understanding to Solomon, and to each We gave judgement and knowledge. And We disposed the mountains and the birds to glorify [Us] with David, and We have been the doer [of such things]

80.Ali Quli Qara'i: We taught him the making of coats of mail for you, to protect you from your [own] violence. Will you then be grateful

81.Ali Quli Qara'i: And for Solomon [We disposed] the tempestuous wind which blew by his command toward the land which We have blessed, and We have knowledge of all things

82.Ali Quli Qara'i: Among the devils were some who dived for him and performed tasks other than that, and We were watchful over them

83.Ali Quli Qara'i: And Job, when he called out to his Lord, ‘Indeed distress has befallen me, and You are the most merciful of the merciful.’

84.Ali Quli Qara'i: So We answered his prayer and removed his distress, and We gave him [back] his family along with others like them, as a mercy from Us, and an admonition for the devout

85.Ali Quli Qara'i: And Ishmael, Idris, and Dhul-Kifl —each of them was among the patient

86.Ali Quli Qara'i: We admitted them into Our mercy. Indeed they were among the righteous

87.Ali Quli Qara'i: And the Man of the Fish, when he left in a rage, thinking that We would not put him to hardship. Then he cried out in the darkness, ‘There is no god except You! You are immaculate! I have indeed been among the wrongdoers!’

88.Ali Quli Qara'i: So We answered his prayer and delivered him from the agony; and thus do We deliver the faithful

89.Ali Quli Qara'i: And Zechariah, when he cried out to his Lord, ‘My Lord! Do not leave me without an heir, and You are the best of inheritors.’

90.Ali Quli Qara'i: So We answered his prayer, and gave him John, and remedied his wife[’s infertility] for him. Indeed they were active in [performing] good works, and they would supplicate Us with eagerness and awe and were humble before Us

91.Ali Quli Qara'i: And her who guarded her chastity, so We breathed into her Our spirit, and made her and her son a sign for all the nations

92.Ali Quli Qara'i: Indeed this community of yours is one community, and I am your Lord. So worship Me

93.Ali Quli Qara'i: They have fragmented their religion among themselves. Everyone of them will return to Us

94.Ali Quli Qara'i: Whoever does righteous deeds, should he be faithful, his endeavour shall not go unappreciated, and We will indeed write it for him

95.Ali Quli Qara'i: It is forbidden for [the people of] any town that We have destroyed [to return to the world]: they shall not return

96.Ali Quli Qara'i: When Gog and Magog are let loose, and they race down from every slope

97.Ali Quli Qara'i: and the true promise draws near [to its fulfillment], behold, the faithless will look on with a fixed gaze: ‘Woe to us! We have certainly been oblivious of this! Rather we have been wrongdoers!’

98.Ali Quli Qara'i: Indeed you and what you worship besides Allah shall be fuel for hell, and you will come to i

99.Ali Quli Qara'i: —had they been gods, they would not have come to it— and they will all remain in it [forever]

100.Ali Quli Qara'i: Their lot therein will be groaning, and they will not hear anything in it

101.Ali Quli Qara'i: Indeed those to whom there has gone beforehand [the promise of] the best reward from Us will be kept away from it

102.Ali Quli Qara'i: They will not hear even its faint sound and they will remain [forever] in what their souls desire

103.Ali Quli Qara'i: The Great Terror will not upset them, and the angels will receive them [saying]: ‘This is your day which you were promised.’

104.Ali Quli Qara'i: The day We shall roll up the sky, like the rolling of the scrolls for writings. We will bring it back as We began the first creation —a promise [binding] on Us. [That] indeed We will do

105.Ali Quli Qara'i: Certainly We wrote in the Psalms, after the Torah: ‘Indeed My righteous servants shall inherit the earth.’

106.Ali Quli Qara'i: There is indeed in this a proclamation for a devout people

107.Ali Quli Qara'i: We did not send you but as a mercy to all the nations

108.Ali Quli Qara'i: Say, ‘It has been revealed to me that your God is the One God. So will you submit?’

109.Ali Quli Qara'i: But if they turn away, say, ‘I have proclaimed to you all alike, and I do not know whether what you have been promised is far or near

110.Ali Quli Qara'i: Indeed He knows whatever is spoken aloud, and He knows whatever you conceal

111.Ali Quli Qara'i: I do not know —maybe it is a trial for you and an enjoyment for a while.’

112.Ali Quli Qara'i: He said, ‘My Lord! Judge with justice.’ ‘Our Lord is the All-beneficent; [He is our] resort against what you allege.’

1.Ali Quli Qara'i: O mankind! Be wary of your Lord! Indeed the quake of the Hour is a terrible thing

2.Ali Quli Qara'i: The day that you will see it, every suckling female will neglect what she suckled, and every pregnant female will deliver her burden, and you will see the people drunk, yet they will not be drunken, but Allah’s punishment is severe

3.Ali Quli Qara'i: Among the people are those who dispute about Allah without any knowledge, and follow every froward devil

4.Ali Quli Qara'i: about whom it has been decreed that should anyone take him for a friend, he will lead him astray, and conduct him toward the punishment of the Blaze

5.Ali Quli Qara'i: O people! If you are in doubt about the resurrection, [consider that] We indeed created you from dust, then from a drop of [seminal] fluid, then from a clinging mass, then from a fleshy tissue, partly formed and partly unformed, so that We may manifest [Our power] to you. We establish in the wombs whatever We wish for a specified term, then We bring you forth as infants, then [We rear you] so that you may come of age. [Then] there are some of you who are taken away, and there are some of you who are relegated to the nethermost age, so that he knows nothing after [having possessed] some knowledge. And you see the earth torpid, yet when We send down water upon it, it stirs and swells, and grows every delightful kind [of plant]

6.Ali Quli Qara'i: That is because Allah is the Reality and it is He who revives the dead, and He has power over all things

7.Ali Quli Qara'i: and the Hour is bound to come, there is no doubt in it, and Allah will resurrect those who are in the graves

8.Ali Quli Qara'i: Among the people are those who dispute concerning Allah without any knowledge or guidance, or an enlightening Book

9.Ali Quli Qara'i: turning aside disdainfully to lead [others] astray from the way of Allah. For such there is disgrace in this world, and on the Day of Resurrection We will make him taste the punishment of the burning

10.Ali Quli Qara'i: ‘That is because of what your hands have sent ahead, and because Allah is not tyrannical to the servants.’

11.Ali Quli Qara'i: And among the people are those who worship Allah on the [very] fringe: if good fortune befalls him, he is content with it; but if an ordeal visits him he makes a turnabout, to become a loser in the world and the Hereafter. That is the manifest loss

12.Ali Quli Qara'i: He invokes besides Allah that which can bring him neither benefit nor harm. That is extreme error

13.Ali Quli Qara'i: He invokes someone whose harm is surely likelier than his benefit. Surely an evil ally and an evil companion

14.Ali Quli Qara'i: Allah will indeed admit those who have faith and do righteous deeds into gardens with streams running in them. Indeed Allah does whatever He desires

15.Ali Quli Qara'i: Whoever thinks that Allah will not help him in this world and the Hereafter, let him extend a rope to the ceiling and hang himself, and see if his artifice would remove his rage

16.Ali Quli Qara'i: Thus have We sent it down as manifest signs, and indeed Allah guides whomever He desires

17.Ali Quli Qara'i: Indeed the faithful, the Jews, the Sabaeans, the Christians, the Magians and the polytheists —Allah will indeed judge between them on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed Allah is witness to all things

18.Ali Quli Qara'i: Have you not regarded that to Allah prostrates whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth, and the sun, the moon, and the stars, the mountains, the trees, and the animals and many of mankind? And for many the punishment has become due. Whomever Allah humiliates will find no one who may bring him honour. Indeed Allah does whatever He wishes

19.Ali Quli Qara'i: These two contenders contend concerning their Lord. As for those who are faithless, cloaks of fire will be cut out for them, and boiling water will be poured over their heads

20.Ali Quli Qara'i: with which their skins and entrails will be fused

21.Ali Quli Qara'i: and there will be clubs of iron for them

22.Ali Quli Qara'i: Whenever they desire to leave it out of anguish, they will be turned back into it [and told]: ‘Taste the punishment of the burning!’

23.Ali Quli Qara'i: Indeed Allah will admit those who have faith and do righteous deeds into gardens with streams running in them, adorned therein with bracelets of gold and pearl, and their dress therein will be silk

24.Ali Quli Qara'i: They shall be guided to the purest speech, and guided to the path of the All-laudable

25.Ali Quli Qara'i: Indeed those who are faithless and who bar from the way of Allah and the Sacred Mosque, which We have assigned for all the people, the native and the visitor being equal therein —whoever seeks to commit therein sacrilege with the intent of wrongdoing, We shall make him taste a painful punishment

26.Ali Quli Qara'i: When We settled for Abraham the site of the House [saying], Do not ascribe any partners to Me, and purify My House for those who go around it, and those who stand [in it for prayer], and those who bow and prostrate

27.Ali Quli Qara'i: And proclaim the á¸¥ajj to people: they shall come to you on foot and on lean camels coming from distant places

28.Ali Quli Qara'i: that they may witness the benefits for them, and mention Allah’s Name during the known days over the livestock He has provided them. So eat thereof, and feed the destitute

29.Ali Quli Qara'i: Then let them do away with their untidiness, and fulfill their vows, and go around the Ancient House

30.Ali Quli Qara'i: That. And whoever venerates the sacraments of Allah, that is better for him with his Lord. You are permitted [animals of] grazing livestock except for what will be recited to you. So avoid the abomination of idols, and avoid false speech

31.Ali Quli Qara'i: as persons having pure faith in Allah, not ascribing partners to Him. Whoever ascribes partners to Allah is as though he had fallen from a height to be devoured by vultures, or to be blown away by the wind far and wide

32.Ali Quli Qara'i: That. And whoever venerates the sacraments of Allah —indeed that arises from the Godwariness of hearts

33.Ali Quli Qara'i: You may benefit from them until a specified time. Then their place of sacrifice is by the Ancient House

34.Ali Quli Qara'i: For every nation We have appointed a rite that they might mention Allah’s Name over the livestock He has provided them. Your God is the One God. So submit to Him. And give good news to the humbl

35.Ali Quli Qara'i: —those whose hearts tremble with awe when Allah is mentioned, and who are patient through whatever visits them, and who maintain the prayer and spend out of what We have provided them

36.Ali Quli Qara'i: We have appointed for you the [sacrificial] camels as one of Allah’s sacraments. There is good for you in them. So mention the Name of Allah over them as they stand. And when they have fallen on their flanks, eat from them, and feed the self-contained needy and the mendicant. Thus have We disposed them for your benefit so that you may give thanks

37.Ali Quli Qara'i: It is not their flesh or their blood that reaches Allah. Rather it is your Godwariness that reaches Him. Thus has He disposed them for your benefit so that you may magnify Allah for His guiding you. And give good news to the virtuous

38.Ali Quli Qara'i: Allah indeed defends those who have faith. Indeed Allah does not like any ingrate traitor

39.Ali Quli Qara'i: Those who are fought against are permitted [to fight] because they have been wronged, and Allah is indeed able to help them

40.Ali Quli Qara'i: —Those who were expelled from their homes unjustly, only because they said, ‘Allah is our Lord.’ Had not Allah repulsed the people from one another, ruin would have befallen the monasteries, churches, synagogues and mosques in which Allah’s Name is mentioned greatly. Allah will surely help those who help Him. Indeed Allah is all-strong, all-mighty

41.Ali Quli Qara'i: Those who, if We granted them power in the land, maintain the prayer, give the zakat, and bid what is right and forbid what is wrong. And with Allah rests the outcome of all matters

42.Ali Quli Qara'i: If they impugn you, the people of Noah have impugned before them and ‘a€d and Thamu

43.Ali Quli Qara'i: [as well as] the people of Abraham and the people of Lot

44.Ali Quli Qara'i: and the inhabitants of Midian, and Moses was also impugned. But I gave the faithless a respite, then I seized them and how was My rebuttal

45.Ali Quli Qara'i: How many towns We have destroyed while they were wrongdoers! So they lie fallen on their trellises, their wells neglected and their lofty palaces [desolate]

46.Ali Quli Qara'i: Have they not traveled over the land so that they may have hearts by which they may apply reason, or ears by which they may hear? Indeed it is not the eyes that turn blind, but the hearts turn blind —those that are in the breasts

47.Ali Quli Qara'i: They ask you to hasten the punishment, though Allah shall never break His promise. Indeed a day with your Lord is like a thousand years of your reckoning

48.Ali Quli Qara'i: To how many a town did I give respite while it was wrongdoing! Then I seized it, and toward Me is the destination

49.Ali Quli Qara'i: Say, ‘O mankind! I am only a manifest warner to you!’

50.Ali Quli Qara'i: As for those who have faith and do righteous deeds, for them is forgiveness and a noble provision

51.Ali Quli Qara'i: But as for those who contend with Our signs, seeking to thwart [their purpose], they shall be the inmates of hell

52.Ali Quli Qara'i: We did not send before you any apostle or prophet but that when he recited [the scripture] Satan interjected [something] in his recitation. Thereat Allah nullifies whatever Satan has interjected, [and] then Allah confirms His signs, and Allah is All-knowing, All-wise

53.Ali Quli Qara'i: That He may make what Satan has thrown in a trial for those in whose hearts is a sickness and those whose hearts have hardened. Indeed the wrongdoers are steeped in extreme defiance

54.Ali Quli Qara'i: That those who have been given knowledge may know that it is the truth from your Lord, and so they may have faith in it, and their hearts may be humbled before Him. Indeed Allah guides those who have faith to a straight path

55.Ali Quli Qara'i: Those who are faithless persist in their doubt about it, until the Hour overtakes them suddenly, or they are overtaken by the punishment of an inauspicious day

56.Ali Quli Qara'i: On that day all sovereignty will belong to Allah: He will judge between them. Then those who have faith and do righteous deeds will be in gardens of bliss

57.Ali Quli Qara'i: and those who are faithless and who deny Our signs —for such there will be a humiliating punishment

58.Ali Quli Qara'i: Those who migrate in the way of Allah and then are slain, or die, Allah will surely provide them with a good provision. Allah is indeed the best of providers

59.Ali Quli Qara'i: He will admit them into an abode they are pleased with. Indeed Allah is all-knowing, all-forbearing

60.Ali Quli Qara'i: That; and whoever retaliates with the like of what he has been made to suffer, and then is [again] aggressed against, Allah will surely help him. Indeed Allah is all-excusing, all-forgiving

61.Ali Quli Qara'i: That is because Allah makes the night pass into the day and makes the day pass into the night, and because Allah is all-hearing, all-seeing

62.Ali Quli Qara'i: That is because Allah is the Reality, and what they invoke besides Him is nullity, and because Allah is the All-exalted, the All-great

63.Ali Quli Qara'i: Have you not regarded that Allah sends down water from the sky, whereupon the earth turns green? Indeed Allah is all-attentive, all-aware

64.Ali Quli Qara'i: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, Indeed Allah is the All-sufficient, the All-laudable

65.Ali Quli Qara'i: Have you not regarded that Allah has disposed for you[r benefit] whatever there is in the earth, and [that] the ships sail at sea by His command, and He sustains the sky lest it should fall on the earth, excepting [when it does so] by His leave? Indeed Allah is most kind and merciful to mankind

66.Ali Quli Qara'i: It is He who gave you life then He makes you die, then He brings you to life. Indeed man is very ungrateful

67.Ali Quli Qara'i: For every nation We had appointed a rite [of worship] which they used to observe; so let them not dispute with you about the matter. And invite to your Lord. Indeed you are on a straight guidance

68.Ali Quli Qara'i: And if they dispute with you, say, ‘Allah knows best what you are doing

69.Ali Quli Qara'i: Allah will judge between you on the Day of Resurrection concerning that about which you used to differ.’

70.Ali Quli Qara'i: Do you not know that Allah knows whatever there is in the sky and the earth? That is indeed in a Book. That is indeed easy for Allah

71.Ali Quli Qara'i: They worship besides Allah that for which He has not sent down any authority, and of which they have no knowledge. And the wrongdoers shall have no helper

72.Ali Quli Qara'i: When Our manifest signs are recited to them, you perceive denial on the faces of the faithless: they would almost pounce upon those who recite Our signs to them. Say, ‘Shall I inform you about something worse than that? The Fire which Allah has promised the faithless. And it is an evil destination.’

73.Ali Quli Qara'i: O mankind! Listen to a parable that is being drawn: Indeed those whom you invoke besides Allah will never create [even] a fly even if they all rallied to do so! And if a fly should take away something from them, they can not recover that from it. Feeble is the seeker and the sought

74.Ali Quli Qara'i: They do not regard Allah with the regard due to Him. Indeed Allah is all-strong, all-mighty

75.Ali Quli Qara'i: Allah chooses messengers from angels and from mankind. Indeed Allah is all-hearing, all-seeing

76.Ali Quli Qara'i: He knows that which is before them and that which is behind them, and to Allah all matters are returned

77.Ali Quli Qara'i: O you who have faith! Bow down and prostrate yourselves, and worship your Lord, and do good, so that you may be felicitous

78.Ali Quli Qara'i: And wage jihad for the sake of Allah, a jihad which is worthy of Him. He has chosen you and has not placed for you any obstacle in the religion, the faith of your father, Abraham. He named you ‘muslims’ before, and in this, so that the Apostle may be a witness to you, and that you may be witnesses to mankind. So maintain the prayer, give the zakat, and hold fast to Allah. He is your master —an excellent master and an excellent helper

1.Ali Quli Qara'i: Certainly, the faithful have attained salvatio

2.Ali Quli Qara'i: —those who are humble in their prayers

3.Ali Quli Qara'i: who avoid vain talk

4.Ali Quli Qara'i: who carry out their [duty of] zakat

5.Ali Quli Qara'i: who guard their private part

6.Ali Quli Qara'i: (except from their spouses or their slave women, for then they are not blameworthy

7.Ali Quli Qara'i: but whoever seeks [anything] beyond that —it is they who are transgressors

8.Ali Quli Qara'i: and those who keep their trusts and covenants

9.Ali Quli Qara'i: and who are watchful of their prayers

10.Ali Quli Qara'i: It is they who will be the inheritors

11.Ali Quli Qara'i: who shall inherit paradise, and will remain in it [forever]

12.Ali Quli Qara'i: Certainly We created man from an extract of clay

13.Ali Quli Qara'i: Then We made him a drop of [seminal] fluid [lodged] in a secure abode

14.Ali Quli Qara'i: Then We created the drop of fluid as a clinging mass. Then We created the clinging mass as a fleshy tissue. Then We created the fleshy tissue as bones. Then We clothed the bones with flesh. Then We produced him as [yet] another creature. So blessed is Allah, the best of creators

15.Ali Quli Qara'i: Then indeed you die after that

16.Ali Quli Qara'i: Then you will indeed be raised up on the Day of Resurrection

17.Ali Quli Qara'i: Certainly We created above you the seven tiers and We have not been oblivious of creation

18.Ali Quli Qara'i: We sent down water from the sky in a measured manner, and We lodged it within the ground, and We are indeed able to take it away

19.Ali Quli Qara'i: Then with it We produced for you gardens of date palms and vines. There are abundant fruits in them for you, and you eat from them

20.Ali Quli Qara'i: And a tree that grows on Mount Sinai which produces oil and a seasoning for those who eat

21.Ali Quli Qara'i: There is indeed a moral for you in the cattle: We give you to drink of that which is in their bellies, and you have many uses in them, and you eat some of them

22.Ali Quli Qara'i: and you are carried on them and on ships

23.Ali Quli Qara'i: Certainly We sent Noah to his people, and he said, ‘O my people! Worship Allah! You have no other god besides Him. Will you not then be wary [of Him]?&rsquo

24.Ali Quli Qara'i: But the elite of the faithless from among his people said, ‘This is just a human being like you, who seeks to dominate you. Had Allah wished, He would have sent down angels. We never heard of such a thing among our forefathers

25.Ali Quli Qara'i: He is just a man possessed by madness. So bear with him for a while.’

26.Ali Quli Qara'i: He said, ‘My Lord! Help me, as they impugn me.’

27.Ali Quli Qara'i: So We revealed to him: ‘Build the ark before Our eyes and by Our revelation. When Our edict comes and the oven gushes [a stream of water], bring into it a pair of every kind [of animal], and your family, except those of them against whom the decree has gone beforehand, and do not plead with Me for those who are wrongdoers: they shall indeed be drowned.’

28.Ali Quli Qara'i: ‘When you, and those who are with you, are settled in the ark, say, ‘‘All praise belongs to Allah, who has delivered us from the wrongdoing lot.’&rsquo

29.Ali Quli Qara'i: And say, ‘‘My Lord! Land me with a blessed landing, for You are the best of those who bring ashore.’’ ’

30.Ali Quli Qara'i: There are indeed signs in this; and indeed We have been testing

31.Ali Quli Qara'i: Then after them We brought forth another generation

32.Ali Quli Qara'i: and We sent them an apostle from among themselves, saying, ‘Worship Allah! You have no other god besides Him. Will you not then be wary [of Him]?&rsquo

33.Ali Quli Qara'i: Said the elite of his people, who were faithless and who denied the encounter of the Hereafter and whom We had given affluence in the life of the world: ‘This is just a human being like you: he eats what you eat, and drinks what you drink

34.Ali Quli Qara'i: If you obey a human being like yourselves, you will indeed be losers

35.Ali Quli Qara'i: Does he promise you that when you have died and become dust and bones you will indeed be raised [from the dead]

36.Ali Quli Qara'i: Far-fetched, far-fetched is what you are promised

37.Ali Quli Qara'i: There is nothing but the life of this world: we live and we die, and we shall not be resurrected

38.Ali Quli Qara'i: He is just a man who has fabricated a lie against Allah, and we will not believe in him.’

39.Ali Quli Qara'i: He said, ‘My Lord! Help me, as they impugn me.’

40.Ali Quli Qara'i: He said, ‘In a little while they will become regretful.’

41.Ali Quli Qara'i: So the Cry seized them justifiably and We turned them into a scum. So away with the wrongdoing lot

42.Ali Quli Qara'i: Then after them We brought forth other generations

43.Ali Quli Qara'i: No nation can advance its time nor can it defer it

44.Ali Quli Qara'i: Then We sent Our apostles successively. Whenever there came to a nation its apostle, they impugned him, so We made them follow one another [to extinction] and We turned them into folktales. So away with the faithless lot

45.Ali Quli Qara'i: Then We sent Moses and Aaron, his brother, with Our signs and a manifest authority

46.Ali Quli Qara'i: to Pharaoh and his elites; but they acted arrogantly and they were a tyrannical lot

47.Ali Quli Qara'i: They said, ‘Shall we believe two humans like ourselves, while their people are our slaves?’

48.Ali Quli Qara'i: So they impugned the two of them, whereat they were among those who were destroyed

49.Ali Quli Qara'i: Certainly We gave Moses the Book so that they might be guided

50.Ali Quli Qara'i: and We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign, and sheltered them in a highland, level and watered by a stream

51.Ali Quli Qara'i: O apostles! Eat of the good things and act righteously. Indeed I know best what you do

52.Ali Quli Qara'i: Indeed this community of yours is one community, and I am your Lord, so be wary of Me

53.Ali Quli Qara'i: But they fragmented their religion among themselves, each party exulting in what it had

54.Ali Quli Qara'i: So leave them in their stupor for a while

55.Ali Quli Qara'i: Do they suppose that whatever aid We provide them in regard to wealth and children [is because]

56.Ali Quli Qara'i: We are eager to bring them good? Rather they are not aware

57.Ali Quli Qara'i: Indeed those who are apprehensive for the fear of their Lord

58.Ali Quli Qara'i: and who believe in the signs of their Lord

59.Ali Quli Qara'i: and who do not ascribe partners to their Lord

60.Ali Quli Qara'i: and who give whatever they give while their hearts tremble with awe that they are going to return to their Lor

61.Ali Quli Qara'i: —it is they who are zealous in [performing] good works, and take the lead in them

62.Ali Quli Qara'i: We task no soul except according to its capacity, and with Us is a book that speaks the truth, and they will not be wronged

63.Ali Quli Qara'i: Rather their hearts are in a stupor in regard to this, and there are their other deeds besides which they perpetrate

64.Ali Quli Qara'i: When We seize their affluent ones with punishment, behold, they make entreaties [to Us]

65.Ali Quli Qara'i: ‘Do not make entreaties today! Indeed you will not receive any help from Us

66.Ali Quli Qara'i: Certainly My signs used to be recited to you, but you used to take to your heels

67.Ali Quli Qara'i: being disdainful of it, talking nonsense in your nightly sessions.’

68.Ali Quli Qara'i: Have they not contemplated the discourse, or has anything come to them [in it] that did not come to their forefathers

69.Ali Quli Qara'i: Is it that they do not recognize their apostle, and so they deny him

70.Ali Quli Qara'i: Do they say, ‘There is madness in him’? Rather he has brought them the truth, and most of them are averse to the truth

71.Ali Quli Qara'i: Had the Truth followed their desires, the heavens and the earth would have surely fallen apart [along] with those who are in them. Rather We have brought them their reminder, but they are disregardful of their reminder

72.Ali Quli Qara'i: Do you ask a recompense from them? Yet your Lord’s recompense is better, and He is the best of providers

73.Ali Quli Qara'i: Indeed you invite them to a straight path

74.Ali Quli Qara'i: and indeed those who do not believe in the Hereafter surely deviate from the path

75.Ali Quli Qara'i: Should We have mercy upon them and remove their distress from them, they would surely persist, bewildered in their rebellion

76.Ali Quli Qara'i: Certainly We have seized them with punishment, yet they neither humbled themselves to their Lord, nor did they entreat [Him for mercy]

77.Ali Quli Qara'i: When We opened on them the door of a severe punishment, behold, they are despondent in it

78.Ali Quli Qara'i: It is He who made for you hearing, eyesight, and hearts. Little do you thank

79.Ali Quli Qara'i: It is He who created you on the earth, and you will be mustered toward Him

80.Ali Quli Qara'i: And it is He who gives life and brings death and due to Him is the alternation of day and night. Do you not apply reason

81.Ali Quli Qara'i: Rather they say just like what the ancients said

82.Ali Quli Qara'i: They said, ‘What, when we are dead and become dust and bones, shall we be resurrected?’

83.Ali Quli Qara'i: Certainly we and our fathers were promised this before. [But] these are nothing but myths of the ancients.’

84.Ali Quli Qara'i: Say, ‘To whom does the earth belong and whoever it contains, if you know?’

85.Ali Quli Qara'i: They will say, ‘To Allah.’ Say, ‘Will you not then take admonition?’

86.Ali Quli Qara'i: Say, ‘Who is the Lord of the seven heavens and the Lord of the Great Throne?’

87.Ali Quli Qara'i: They will say, ‘[They belong] to Allah.’ Say, ‘Will you not then be wary [of Him]?&rsquo

88.Ali Quli Qara'i: Say, ‘In whose hand is the dominion of all things, and who shelters and no shelter can be provided from Him, if you know?’

89.Ali Quli Qara'i: They will say, ‘[They all belong] to Allah.’ Say, ‘Then how are you being deluded?’

90.Ali Quli Qara'i: Rather We have brought them the truth, and they are indeed liars

91.Ali Quli Qara'i: Allah has not taken any offspring, neither is there any god besides Him, for then each god would take away what he created, and some of them would surely rise up against others. Clear is Allah of what they allege

92.Ali Quli Qara'i: The Knower of the sensible and the Unseen, He is above having any partners that they ascribe [to Him]

93.Ali Quli Qara'i: Say, ‘My Lord! If You should show me what they are promised

94.Ali Quli Qara'i: then do not put me, my Lord, among the wrongdoing lot.’

95.Ali Quli Qara'i: We are indeed able to show you what We promise them

96.Ali Quli Qara'i: Repel ill [conduct] with that which is the best. We know best whatever they allege

97.Ali Quli Qara'i: And say, ‘My Lord! I seek Your protection from the promptings of devils

98.Ali Quli Qara'i: and I seek Your protection, my Lord, from their presence near me.’

99.Ali Quli Qara'i: When death comes to one of them, he says, ‘My Lord! Take me back

100.Ali Quli Qara'i: that I may act righteously in what I have left behind.’ ‘By no means! These are mere words that he says.’ And ahead of them is a barrier until the day they will be resurrecte

101.Ali Quli Qara'i: And when the Trumpet is blown, there will be no ties between them on that day, nor will they ask [about] each other

102.Ali Quli Qara'i: Then those whose deeds weigh heavy in the scales —it is they who are the felicitous

103.Ali Quli Qara'i: As for those whose deeds weigh light in the scales, —they will be the ones who have ruined their souls, [and] they will remain in hell [forever]

104.Ali Quli Qara'i: The Fire will scorch their faces, and they will be morose in it

105.Ali Quli Qara'i: ‘Was it not that My signs were recited to you but you would deny them?’

106.Ali Quli Qara'i: They will say, ‘Our Lord! Our wretchedness overcame us, and we were an astray lot

107.Ali Quli Qara'i: Our Lord! Bring us out of this! Then, if we revert, we will indeed be wrongdoers.’

108.Ali Quli Qara'i: He will say, ‘Begone in it, and do not speak to Me

109.Ali Quli Qara'i: Indeed there was a part of My servants who would say, ‘‘Our Lord! We have believed. So forgive us, and have mercy on us, and You are the best of the merciful.’&rsquo

110.Ali Quli Qara'i: But then you took them by ridicule until they made you forget My remembrance, and you used to laugh at them

111.Ali Quli Qara'i: Indeed I have rewarded them today for their patience. They are indeed the triumphant.’

112.Ali Quli Qara'i: He will say, ‘How many years did you remain on earth?’

113.Ali Quli Qara'i: They will say, ‘We remained for a day, or part of a day; yet ask those who keep the count.’

114.Ali Quli Qara'i: He will say, ‘You only remained a little; if only you had known

115.Ali Quli Qara'i: Did you suppose that We created you aimlessly, and that you will not be brought back to Us?’

116.Ali Quli Qara'i: So exalted is Allah, the True Sovereign, there is no god except Him, the Lord of the Noble Throne

117.Ali Quli Qara'i: Whoever invokes besides Allah another god of which he has no proof, his reckoning will indeed rest with his Lord. Indeed the faithless will not be felicitous

118.Ali Quli Qara'i: Say, ‘My Lord, forgive and have mercy, and You are the best of the merciful.’

1.Ali Quli Qara'i: [This is] a surah which We have sent down, and prescribed it, and We have sent down in it manifest signs so that you may take admonition

2.Ali Quli Qara'i: As for the fornicatress and the fornicator, strike each of them a hundred lashes, and let not pity for them overcome you in Allah’s law, if you believe in Allah and the Last Day, and let their punishment be witnessed by a group of the faithful

3.Ali Quli Qara'i: The fornicator shall not marry anyone but a fornicatress or an idolatress, and the fornicatress shall be married by none except a fornicator or an idolater, and that is forbidden to the faithful

4.Ali Quli Qara'i: As for those who accuse honourable women and do not bring four witnesses, strike them eighty lashes, and never accept any testimony from them after that, and they are transgressors

5.Ali Quli Qara'i: excepting those who repent after that and reform, for Allah is indeed all-forgiving, all-merciful

6.Ali Quli Qara'i: As for those who accuse their wives, but have no witnesses except themselves, then the testimony of one of them shall be a fourfold testimony [sworn] by Allah that he is indeed stating the truth

7.Ali Quli Qara'i: and a fifth [oath] that Allah’s wrath shall be upon him if he were lying

8.Ali Quli Qara'i: The punishment shall be averted from her by her testifying with four oaths [sworn] by Allah that he is indeed lying

9.Ali Quli Qara'i: and a fifth [oath] that Allah’s wrath shall be upon her if he were stating the truth

10.Ali Quli Qara'i: Were it not for Allah’s grace and His mercy upon you, and that Allah is all-clement, all-wise. . .

11.Ali Quli Qara'i: Indeed those who initiated the calumny are a band from among yourselves. Do not suppose it is bad for you. Rather it is for your good. Each man among them bears [the onus for] his share in the sin, and as for him who assumed its major burden from among them there is a great punishment for him

12.Ali Quli Qara'i: When you [first] heard about it, why did not the faithful, men and women, think well of their folks, and say, ‘This is an obvious calumny’

13.Ali Quli Qara'i: Why did they not bring four witnesses to it? So when they could not bring the witnesses, they are liars in Allah’s sight

14.Ali Quli Qara'i: Were it not for Allah’s grace and His mercy upon you in this world and the Hereafter, there would have befallen you a great punishment for what you ventured into

15.Ali Quli Qara'i: when you were receiving it on your tongues, and were mouthing something of which you had no knowledge, supposing it to be a light matter, while it was a grave [matter] with Allah

16.Ali Quli Qara'i: And why did you not, when you heard it, say, ‘It is not for us to say such a thing. [O Allah!] You are immaculate! This is a monstrous calumny!’

17.Ali Quli Qara'i: Allah advises you lest you should ever repeat the like of it, should you be faithful

18.Ali Quli Qara'i: Allah clarifies the signs for you, and Allah is all-knowing, all-wise

19.Ali Quli Qara'i: Indeed those who want indecency to spread among the faithful —there is a painful punishment for them in the world and the Hereafter, and Allah knows and you do not know

20.Ali Quli Qara'i: Were it not for Allah’s grace and His mercy upon you, and that Allah is all-kind, all-merciful

21.Ali Quli Qara'i: O you who have faith! Do not follow in Satan’s steps. Whoever follows in Satan’s steps [should know that] he indeed prompts [you to commit] indecent acts and wrong. Were it not for Allah’s grace and His mercy upon you, not one of you would ever be pure. But Allah purifies whomever He wishes, and Allah is all-hearing, all-knowing

22.Ali Quli Qara'i: Let the well-off and the opulent among you not vow not to give to the relatives and the needy, and to those who have migrated in the way of Allah, and let them excuse and forbear. Do you not love that Allah should forgive you? And Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful

23.Ali Quli Qara'i: Indeed those who accuse honourable and unwary faithful women shall be cursed in this world and the Hereafter, and there shall be a great punishment for the

24.Ali Quli Qara'i: on the day when witness shall be given against them by their tongues, their hands, and their feet concerning what they used to do

25.Ali Quli Qara'i: On that day Allah will pay them in full their due recompense, and they shall know that Allah is the Manifest Reality

26.Ali Quli Qara'i: Vicious women are for vicious men, and vicious men for vicious women. Good women are for good men, and good men for good women. These are absolved of what they say [about them]. For them is forgiveness and a noble provision

27.Ali Quli Qara'i: O you who have faith! Do not enter houses other than your own until you have announced [your arrival] and greeted their occupants. That is better for you. Maybe you will take admonition

28.Ali Quli Qara'i: But if you do not find anyone in them, do not enter them until you are given permission, and if you are told: ‘Turn back,’ then do turn back. That is more decent for you. And Allah knows best what you do

29.Ali Quli Qara'i: There will be no sin upon you in entering [without announcing] uninhabited houses wherein you have goods belonging to you. And Allah knows whatever you disclose and whatever you conceal

30.Ali Quli Qara'i: Tell the faithful men to cast down their looks and to guard their private parts. That is more decent for them. Allah is indeed well aware of what they do

31.Ali Quli Qara'i: And tell the faithful women to cast down their looks and to guard their private parts, and not to display their charms, except for what is outward, and let them draw their scarfs over their bosoms, and not display their charms except to their husbands, or their fathers, or their husband’s fathers, or their sons, or their husband’s sons, or their brothers, or their brothers’ sons, or their sisters’ sons, or their women, or their slave girls, or male dependants lacking [sexual] desire, or children uninitiated to women’s parts. And let them not thump their feet to make known their hidden ornaments. Rally to Allah in repentance, O faithful, so that you may be felicitous

32.Ali Quli Qara'i: Marry off those who are single among you and the upright among your male slaves and your female slaves. If they are poor, Allah will enrich them out of His grace, and Allah is all-bounteous, all-knowing

33.Ali Quli Qara'i: Those who cannot afford marriage should be continent until Allah enriches them out of His grace. As for those who seek an emancipation deal from among your slaves, make such a deal with them if you know any good in them, and give them out of the wealth of Allah which He has given you. Do not compel your female slaves to prostitution when they desire to be chaste, seeking the transitory wares of the life of this world. Should anyone compel them, then after their compulsion Allah is indeed all-forgiving, all-merciful

34.Ali Quli Qara'i: Certainly We have sent down to you manifest signs and a description of those who passed before you, and an advice for the Godwary

35.Ali Quli Qara'i: Allah is the Light of the heavens and the earth. The parable of His Light is a niche wherein is a lamp —the lamp is in a glass, the glass as it were a glittering star— lit from a blessed olive tree, neither eastern nor western, whose oil almost lights up, though fire should not touch it. Light upon light. Allah guides to His Light whomever He wishes. Allah draws parables for mankind, and Allah has knowledge of all things

36.Ali Quli Qara'i: In houses Allah has allowed to be raised and wherein His Name is celebrated, He is glorified therein, morning and evening

37.Ali Quli Qara'i: by men whom neither trading nor bargaining distracts from the remembrance of Allah, and the maintenance of prayer and the giving of zakat. They are fearful of a day wherein the heart and the sight will be transformed

38.Ali Quli Qara'i: so that Allah may reward them by the best of what they have done, and enhance them out of His grace, and Allah provides for whomever He wishes without any reckoning

39.Ali Quli Qara'i: As for the faithless, their works are like a mirage in a plain, which the thirsty man supposes to be water. When he comes to it, he finds it to be nothing; but there he finds Allah, who will pay him his full account, and Allah is swift at reckoning

40.Ali Quli Qara'i: Or like the manifold darkness in a deep sea, covered by billow upon billow, overcast by clouds, manifold [layers of] darkness, one on top of another: when he brings out his hand, he can hardly see it, and one whom Allah has not granted any light has no light

41.Ali Quli Qara'i: Have you not regarded that Allah is glorified by everyone in the heavens and the earth, and the birds spreading their wings. Each knows his prayer and glorification, and Allah knows best what they do

42.Ali Quli Qara'i: To Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and toward Allah is the destination

43.Ali Quli Qara'i: Have you not regarded that Allah drives the clouds, then He composes them, then He piles them up, whereat you see the rain issuing from its midst? And He sends down from the sky hail, out of the mountains that are in it, and He strikes with it whomever He wishes, and turns it away from whomever He wishes. The brilliance of its lightening almost takes away the sight

44.Ali Quli Qara'i: Allah alternates the night and the day. There is indeed a moral in that for those who have insight

45.Ali Quli Qara'i: Allah created every animal from water. Among them are some that creep upon their bellies, and among them are some that walk on two feet, and among them are some that walk on four. Allah creates whatever He wishes. Indeed Allah has power over all things

46.Ali Quli Qara'i: Certainly We have sent down manifest signs, and Allah guides whomever He wishes to a straight path

47.Ali Quli Qara'i: They say, ‘We have faith in Allah and His Apostle, and we obey.’ Then after that a part of them refuse to comply, and they do not have faith

48.Ali Quli Qara'i: When they are summoned to Allah and His Apostle that He may judge between them, behold, a part of them turn aside

49.Ali Quli Qara'i: But if justice be on their side, they come compliantly to him

50.Ali Quli Qara'i: Is there a sickness in their hearts? Or do they have doubts or fear that Allah and His Apostle will be unjust to them? Rather it is they who are the wrongdoers

51.Ali Quli Qara'i: All the response of the faithful, when they are summoned to Allah and His Apostle that He may judge between them, is to say, ‘We hear and obey.’ It is they who are the felicitous

52.Ali Quli Qara'i: Whoever obeys Allah and His Apostle, and fears Allah and is wary of Him —it is they who will be the triumphant

53.Ali Quli Qara'i: They swear by Allah with solemn oaths that if you order them they will surely go forth. Say, ‘Do not swear! Honourable obedience [is all that is expected of you]. Allah is indeed well aware of what you do.’

54.Ali Quli Qara'i: Say, ‘Obey Allah, and obey the Apostle.’ But if you turn your backs, [you should know that] he is only responsible for his burden and you are responsible for your burden, and if you obey him, you shall be guided, and the Apostle’s duty is only to communicate in clear terms

55.Ali Quli Qara'i: Allah has promised those of you who have faith and do righteous deeds that He will surely make them successors in the earth, just as He made those who were before them successors, and He will surely establish for them their religion which He has approved for them, and that He will surely change their state to security after their fear, while they worship Me, not ascribing any partners to Me. And whoever is ungrateful after that —it is they who are the transgressors

56.Ali Quli Qara'i: Maintain the prayer and give the zakat, and obey the Apostle so that you may receive [Allah’s] mercy

57.Ali Quli Qara'i: Do not suppose that those who are faithless can thwart [Allah] on the earth. Their refuge shall be the Fire, and it is surely an evil destination

58.Ali Quli Qara'i: O you who have faith! Let your permission be sought by your slaves and those of you who have not reached puberty three times: before the dawn prayer, and when you put off your garments at noon, and after the night prayer. These are three times of privacy for you. Apart from these, it is not sinful of you or them to frequent one another [freely]. Thus does Allah clarify the signs for you, and Allah is all-knowing, all-wise

59.Ali Quli Qara'i: When your children reach puberty, let them ask permission [at all times] just as those who asked permission before them. Thus does Allah clarify His signs for you, and Allah is all-knowing, all-wise

60.Ali Quli Qara'i: As for women advanced in years who do not expect to marry, there will be no sin upon them if they put off their cloaks, without displaying their adornment. But it is better for them to be continent, and Allah is all-hearing, all-knowing

61.Ali Quli Qara'i: There is no blame upon the blind, nor any blame upon the lame, nor any blame upon the sick, nor upon yourselves if you eat from your own houses, or your fathers’ houses, or your mothers’ houses, or your brothers’ houses, or your sisters’ houses, or the houses of your paternal uncles, or the houses of your paternal aunts, or the houses of your maternal uncles, or the houses of your maternal aunts, or those whose keys are in your possession, or those of your friends. There will be no blame on you whether you eat together or separately. So when you enter houses, greet yourselves with a salutation from Allah, blessed and good. Thus does Allah clarify His signs for you so that you may apply reason

62.Ali Quli Qara'i: Indeed the faithful are those who have faith in Allah and His Apostle, and when they are with him in a collective affair, they do not leave until they have sought his permission. Indeed those who seek your permission —it is they who have faith in Allah and His Apostle. So when they seek your permission for some work of theirs, give permission to whomever of them you wish and plead with Allah to forgive them. Indeed Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful

63.Ali Quli Qara'i: Do not consider the Apostle’s summons amongst you to be like your summoning one another. Allah certainly knows those of you who slip away under cover. So let those who disobey his orders beware lest an ordeal should visit them or a painful punishment should befall them

64.Ali Quli Qara'i: Look! To Allah indeed belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. He certainly knows what you are up to, and the day they are brought back to Him He will inform them about what they have done, and Allah has knowledge of all things

1.Ali Quli Qara'i: Blessed is He who sent down the Criterion to His servant that he may be a warner to all the nations

2.Ali Quli Qara'i: He, to whom belongs the sovereignty of the heavens and the earth, and who did not take a son, nor has He any partner in sovereignty, and He created everything and determined it in a precise measure

3.Ali Quli Qara'i: Yet they have taken gods besides Him who create nothing and have themselves been created, and who have no control over their own harm or benefit and have no control over [their own] death, or life, or resurrection

4.Ali Quli Qara'i: The faithless say, ‘This is nothing but a lie that he has fabricated, and other people have abetted him in it.’ Thus they have certainly come out with wrongdoing and falsehood

5.Ali Quli Qara'i: They say, ‘He has taken down myths of the ancients, and they are dictated to him morning and evening.’

6.Ali Quli Qara'i: Say, ‘It has been sent down by Him who knows the hidden in the heavens and the earth. Indeed He is all-forgiving, all-merciful.’

7.Ali Quli Qara'i: And they say, ‘What sort of apostle is this who eats food and walks in the marketplaces? Why has not an angel been sent down to him so as to be a warner along with him?’

8.Ali Quli Qara'i: Or, ‘[Why is not] a treasure thrown to him, or [why does] he [not] have a garden from which he may eat?’ And the wrongdoers say, ‘You are just following a bewitched man.’

9.Ali Quli Qara'i: Look, how they draw comparisons for you; so they go astray, and cannot find the way

10.Ali Quli Qara'i: Blessed is He who will grant you better than that if He wishes —gardens with streams running in them, and He will make for you palaces

11.Ali Quli Qara'i: Rather they deny the Hour, and We have prepared a Blaze for those who deny the Hour

12.Ali Quli Qara'i: When it sights them from a distant place, they will hear it raging and roaring

13.Ali Quli Qara'i: And when they are cast into a narrow place in it, bound together [in chains], they will pray for [their own] annihilation

14.Ali Quli Qara'i: [They will be told:] ‘Do not pray for a single annihilation today, but pray for many annihilations!’

15.Ali Quli Qara'i: Say, ‘Is that better, or the everlasting paradise promised to the Godwary, which will be their reward and destination?’

16.Ali Quli Qara'i: There they will have whatever they wish, abiding [forever], a promise [much] besought, [binding] on your Lord

17.Ali Quli Qara'i: On the day that He will muster them and those whom they worship besides Allah, He will say, ‘Was it you who led astray these servants of Mine, or did they themselves stray from the way?’

18.Ali Quli Qara'i: They will say, ‘Immaculate are You! It does not behoove us to take any guardians in Your stead! But You provided for them and their fathers until they forgot the Reminder, and they were a ruined lot.’

19.Ali Quli Qara'i: So they will certainly impugn you in what you say, and you will neither be able to circumvent [punishment] nor find help, and whoever of you does wrong, We shall make him taste a terrible punishment

20.Ali Quli Qara'i: We did not send any apostles before you but that they indeed ate food and walked in marketplaces. We have made you a trial for one another, [to see] if you will be patient, and your Lord is all-seeing

21.Ali Quli Qara'i: Those who do not expect to encounter Us say, ‘Why have angels not been sent down to us, or why do we not see our Lord?’ Certainly they are full of arrogance within their souls and have become terribly defiant

22.Ali Quli Qara'i: The day when they see the angels, there will be no good news for the guilty that day, and they will say, ‘Keep off [from paradise]!&rsquo

23.Ali Quli Qara'i: Then We shall attend to the works they have done and then turn them into scattered dust

24.Ali Quli Qara'i: On that day the inhabitants of paradise will be in the best abode and an excellent resting place

25.Ali Quli Qara'i: The day when the sky with its clouds will split open, and the angels will be sent down [in a majestic] descent

26.Ali Quli Qara'i: on that day true sovereignty will belong to the All-beneficent, and it will be a hard day for the faithless

27.Ali Quli Qara'i: A day when the wrongdoer will bite his hands, saying, ‘I wish I had followed the Apostle’s way

28.Ali Quli Qara'i: Woe to me! I wish I had not taken so and so as a friend

29.Ali Quli Qara'i: Certainly he led me astray from the Reminder after it had come to me, and Satan is a deserter of man.’

30.Ali Quli Qara'i: And the Apostle will say, ‘O my Lord! Indeed my people consigned this Qur’an to oblivion.’

31.Ali Quli Qara'i: That is how for every prophet We assigned an enemy from among the guilty, and your Lord suffices as helper and guide

32.Ali Quli Qara'i: The faithless say, ‘Why has not the Qur’an been sent down to him all at once?’ So it is, that We may strengthen your heart with it, and We have recited it [to you] in a measured tone

33.Ali Quli Qara'i: They do not bring you any poser but that We bring you the truth [in reply to them] and the best exposition

34.Ali Quli Qara'i: Those who will be mustered on their faces toward hell, they are the worse situated and further astray from the [right] way

35.Ali Quli Qara'i: Certainly We gave Moses the Book and We made Aaron, his brother, accompany him as a minister

36.Ali Quli Qara'i: Then We said, ‘Let the two of you go to the people who have denied Our signs.’ Then We destroyed them utterly

37.Ali Quli Qara'i: And Noah’s people, We drowned them when they impugned the apostles, and We made them a sign for mankind, and We have prepared for the wrongdoers a painful punishment

38.Ali Quli Qara'i: And ‘a€d and Thamud, and the inhabitants of Rass, and many generations between them

39.Ali Quli Qara'i: For each of them We drew examples, and each We destroyed utterly

40.Ali Quli Qara'i: Certainly they must have passed the town on which an evil shower was rained. Have they not seen it? Rather they did not expect resurrection

41.Ali Quli Qara'i: When they see you they just take you in derision: ‘Is this the one whom Allah has sent as an apostle!

42.Ali Quli Qara'i: Indeed he was about to lead us astray from our gods, had we not stood by them.’ Soon they will know, when they sight the punishment, who is further astray from the [right] way

43.Ali Quli Qara'i: Have you seen him who has taken his desire to be his god? Is it your duty to watch over him

44.Ali Quli Qara'i: Do you suppose that most of them listen or apply reason? They are just like cattle; rather they are further astray from the way

45.Ali Quli Qara'i: Have you not regarded how your Lord spreads the twilight? (Had He wished He would have made it still.) Then We made the sun a beacon for it

46.Ali Quli Qara'i: Then We retract it toward Ourselves, with a gentle retracting

47.Ali Quli Qara'i: It is He who made for you the night as a covering and sleep for rest and He made the day a recall to life

48.Ali Quli Qara'i: And it is He who sends the winds as harbingers of His mercy, and We send down from the sky purifying water

49.Ali Quli Qara'i: with which We revive a dead country and provide water to many of the cattle and humans We have created

50.Ali Quli Qara'i: Certainly We distribute it among them so that they may take admonition. But most people are only intent on ingratitude

51.Ali Quli Qara'i: Had We wished, We would have sent a warner to every town

52.Ali Quli Qara'i: So do not obey the faithless, but wage against them a great jihad with it

53.Ali Quli Qara'i: It is He who merged the two seas: this one sweet and agreeable, and that one briny and bitter, and between the two He set a barrier and a forbidding hindrance

54.Ali Quli Qara'i: It is He who created the human being from water, then invested him with ties of blood and marriage, and your Lord is all-powerful

55.Ali Quli Qara'i: They worship besides Allah that which neither brings them any benefit nor causes them any harm, and the faithless one is ever an abettor against his Lord

56.Ali Quli Qara'i: We did not send you except as a bearer of good news and as a warner

57.Ali Quli Qara'i: Say, ‘I do not ask you any reward for it, except that anyone who wishes should take the way to his Lord.’

58.Ali Quli Qara'i: Put your trust in the Living One who does not die, and celebrate His praise. He suffices as one all-aware of the sins of His servants

59.Ali Quli Qara'i: He, who created the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them in six days, and then settled on the Throne, the All-beneficent; so ask someone who is well aware about Him

60.Ali Quli Qara'i: When they are told: ‘Prostrate yourselves before the All-beneficent,’ they say, ‘What is ‘‘the All-beneficent’’? Shall we prostrate ourselves before whatever you bid us?’ And it increases their aversion

61.Ali Quli Qara'i: Blessed is He who appointed houses in the sky and set in it a lamp and a shining moon

62.Ali Quli Qara'i: It is He who made the night and the day alternate for one who desires to take admonition, or desires to give thanks

63.Ali Quli Qara'i: The servants of the All-beneficent are those who walk humbly on the earth, and when the ignorant address them, say, ‘Peace!&rsquo

64.Ali Quli Qara'i: Those who spend the night for their Lord, prostrating and standing [in worship]

65.Ali Quli Qara'i: Those who say, ‘Our Lord! Turn away from us the punishment of hell. Indeed its punishment is enduring

66.Ali Quli Qara'i: Indeed it is an evil abode and place.’

67.Ali Quli Qara'i: Those who, when spending, are neither wasteful nor tightfisted, and moderation lies between these [extremes]

68.Ali Quli Qara'i: Those who do not invoke another god besides Allah, and do not kill a soul [whose life] Allah has made inviolable, except with due cause, and do not commit fornication. (Whoever does that shall encounter its retribution

69.Ali Quli Qara'i: the punishment being doubled for him on the Day of Resurrection. In it he will abide in humiliation forever

70.Ali Quli Qara'i: excepting those who repent, attain faith, and act righteously. For such, Allah will replace their misdeeds with good deeds, and Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful

71.Ali Quli Qara'i: And whoever repents and acts righteously indeed turns to Allah with due penitence)

72.Ali Quli Qara'i: Those who do not give false testimony, and when they come upon vain talk, pass by nobly

73.Ali Quli Qara'i: Those who, when reminded of the signs of their Lord, do not turn a deaf ear and a blind eye to them

74.Ali Quli Qara'i: And those who say, ‘Our Lord! Grant us comfort in our spouses and descendants, and make us imams of the Godwary.’

75.Ali Quli Qara'i: Those shall be rewarded with sublime abodes for their patience, and they shall be met there with greetings and ‘Peace,&rsquo

76.Ali Quli Qara'i: to abide in them [forever], an excellent abode and place

77.Ali Quli Qara'i: Say, ‘What store my Lord would set by you were it not for your supplication? But you impugned [me and my advice], so that will continue to haunt you.’

1.Ali Quli Qara'i: Ta, Sa«n, Ma«m

2.Ali Quli Qara'i: These are the signs of the Manifest Book

3.Ali Quli Qara'i: You are liable to imperil your life [out of distress] that they will not have faith

4.Ali Quli Qara'i: If We wish We will send down to them a sign from the sky before which their heads will remain bowed in humility

5.Ali Quli Qara'i: There would not come to them any new reminder from the All-beneficent but that they used to disregard it

6.Ali Quli Qara'i: They have certainly denied [the truth], but soon there will come to them the news of what they have been deriding

7.Ali Quli Qara'i: Have they not regarded the earth, how many We have caused to grow in it of every splendid kind [of vegetation]

8.Ali Quli Qara'i: There is indeed a sign in that; but most of them do not have faith

9.Ali Quli Qara'i: Indeed your Lord is the All-mighty, the All-merciful

10.Ali Quli Qara'i: When your Lord called out to Moses: [saying,] ‘Go to the wrongdoing people

11.Ali Quli Qara'i: the people of Pharaoh. Will they not be wary [of Allah]?&rsquo

12.Ali Quli Qara'i: He said, ‘My Lord! I fear they will impugn me

13.Ali Quli Qara'i: and I will become upset, and my tongue will fail me. So send [Your messenger] to Aaron

14.Ali Quli Qara'i: Also they have a charge against me, and I fear they will kill me.’

15.Ali Quli Qara'i: He said, ‘Certainly not! Let the two of you go with Our signs: We will indeed be with you, hearing [everything]

16.Ali Quli Qara'i: So approach Pharaoh and say, ‘‘We are indeed envoys of the Lord of the world

17.Ali Quli Qara'i: that you let the Children of Israel go with us.’’ ’

18.Ali Quli Qara'i: He said, ‘Did we not rear you as a child among us, and did you not stay with us for years of your life

19.Ali Quli Qara'i: Then you committed that deed of yours, and you are an ingrate.’

20.Ali Quli Qara'i: He said, ‘I did that when I was astray

21.Ali Quli Qara'i: So I fled from you, as I was afraid of you. Then my Lord gave me judgement and made me one of the apostles

22.Ali Quli Qara'i: As for that favour, you remind me of it reproachfully because you have enslaved the Children of Israel.’

23.Ali Quli Qara'i: He said, ‘And what is ‘‘the Lord of all the worlds?’’ ’

24.Ali Quli Qara'i: He said, ‘The Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, —should you have conviction.’

25.Ali Quli Qara'i: He said to those who were around him, ‘Don’t you hear?!’

26.Ali Quli Qara'i: He said, ‘Your Lord, and the Lord of your forefathers!’

27.Ali Quli Qara'i: He said, ‘Indeed your messenger, who has been sent to you, is surely crazy!’

28.Ali Quli Qara'i: He said, ‘The Lord of the east and the west and whatever is between them —should you apply reason.’

29.Ali Quli Qara'i: He said, ‘If you take up any god other than me, I will surely make you a prisoner!’

30.Ali Quli Qara'i: He said, ‘What if I bring you something manifest?’

31.Ali Quli Qara'i: He said, ‘Then bring it, should you be truthful.’

32.Ali Quli Qara'i: Thereat he threw down his staff, and behold, it was a manifest python

33.Ali Quli Qara'i: Then he drew out his hand, and behold, it was white to the onlookers

34.Ali Quli Qara'i: He said to the elite [who stood] around him, ‘This is indeed an expert magicia

35.Ali Quli Qara'i: who seeks to expel you from your land with his magic. So what do you advise?’

36.Ali Quli Qara'i: They said, ‘Put him and his brother off for a while, and send heralds to the citie

37.Ali Quli Qara'i: to bring you every expert magician.’

38.Ali Quli Qara'i: So the magicians were gathered for the tryst of a known day

39.Ali Quli Qara'i: and the people were told: ‘Will you gather?!’

40.Ali Quli Qara'i: ‘Maybe we will follow the magicians, should they be the victors!’

41.Ali Quli Qara'i: So when the magicians came, they said to Pharaoh, ‘Shall we indeed have a reward if we were to be the victors?’

42.Ali Quli Qara'i: He said, ‘ Of course; and indeed you shall be among those near [to me].&rsquo

43.Ali Quli Qara'i: Moses said to them, ‘Throw down what you have to throw!’

44.Ali Quli Qara'i: So they threw down their sticks and ropes, and said, ‘By the might of Pharaoh, we shall surely be the victors!’

45.Ali Quli Qara'i: Thereat Moses threw down his staff, and behold, it was swallowing what they had faked

46.Ali Quli Qara'i: Thereat the magicians fell down prostrating

47.Ali Quli Qara'i: They said, ‘We believe in the Lord of all the worlds

48.Ali Quli Qara'i: the Lord of Moses and Aaron.’

49.Ali Quli Qara'i: He said, ‘Do you profess faith in Him before I permit you? He is indeed your chief who has taught you magic! Soon you will surely know! Surely I will cut off your hands and feet from opposite sides, and I will surely crucify you all.’

50.Ali Quli Qara'i: They said, ‘[There is] no harm [in that]! Indeed we shall return to our Lord

51.Ali Quli Qara'i: Indeed we hope our Lord will forgive us our iniquities for being the first to believe.’

52.Ali Quli Qara'i: Then We revealed to Moses, [saying], ‘Take My servants on a journey by night, for you will be pursued.’

53.Ali Quli Qara'i: Then Pharaoh sent heralds to the cities

54.Ali Quli Qara'i: [announcing:] ‘These are indeed a small gang

55.Ali Quli Qara'i: They have surely aroused our wrath

56.Ali Quli Qara'i: and indeed we are all on our guard.’

57.Ali Quli Qara'i: So We expelled them from gardens and springs

58.Ali Quli Qara'i: and [from] treasures and splendid places
